name: Arcane Engineer (Stealth Wizard [Rogue Hybrid] + Crossbow + Traps)
author: NobleSky

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
In this build, I want to combine the versatility of wizard spells with the usability of stealth. I am not trying to build a character that can take out enemies one by one from the cover of stealth (this isn't Skyrim). I aim for a wizard who use stealth to scout the fields ahead of him, planning your moves ahead, and if possible, lay traps to weaken or take out enemies mob. Your primary means of damage is your spells, and crossbow will be your secondary alternative. Why wizard? Primary stat for wizard is INT (for stronger spell or higher DC) and INT modifier is applied as a bonus to disarm trap skill (minimum 48 to recover, not disable, epic traps). A thorough guide to laying traps is discussed in Unravelling the World of NWN Traps: A Primer made by HipMaestro.

Why crossbow? The wizard build that I want to build is going to wear a robe instead of armor. I don't like to place him anywhere near front-line and prefer to attack from range, so either spells or ranged weapon. There is a penalty to damage dealt by ranged weapons (with the exceptions of crossbow and shuriken) for minus STR modifier. For the build's optimization, starting STR will be set to 8 (-1 STR modifier). Not to mention, crossbow (light or heavy) is listed as wizard weapon proficiency. There is also a flavor of role-play about a wizard who is not only a master of arcane matters, but engineering mechanics like crossbow and trap laying.  

I am still undecided to tertiary class. I can go for WIZ32/ROG4/FIG4 for EWS crossbow ( I am kinda leaning to light crossbow at the moment, though I won't dismiss going with heavy crossbow). Other option is WIZ35/ROG4/SD1 for hide in plain sight feat. I also don't know about the stealth mechanic combined with spells. I know that if you cast offensive spells while in stealth, you are broken from your cover and will be discovered by anyone near you. For non-offensive spell, you are still invisible to your enemies (if your Hide and Move Silently DC is greater than their Spot or Listen DC, or if they don't have true seeing or dark vision feat) but the sound effect of the spell can still be heard (not sure if cast as silent spell though). An insight from anyone who has experience as  stealth-spellcaster hybrid will be invaluable for this build.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail NobleSky
Cool idea, an arcane engineer wizard/rogue type build.
Maybe make it a gnome for wizard as favored class, +1AB from small size and bonuses to stealth and detection from small size as well!
Fits well from an RP perspective, and gnomes can use heavy crossbows.
I think your biggest challenge with wizard/rogue and crossbow might be getting enough AB if you are Int focused.
Also whether you will be happy with 2 attacks / round without haste, or if you wanted to get BAB 21-25 for 3 attacks / round for 3 attacks / round without haste.
Damage output might be minimal too with the crossbow without decent ammunition, unless you play in environment where buffs like flame weapon can be applied to them.

I found HiPS useful however a wand of invisibility can also help with repositioning as well if you have craft wand. 
Also Greater Sanctuary if you have it, although there are times when some opponents enemies will attack you despite greater sanctuary, namely AoE spells, attacks of opportunity (ie when spellcasting in melee range)
Monk speed may also be a consideration. With extended mass haste and expeditious retreat you will break the speed barrier.
The main downside is the 3 monk level investment, investing in caster levels early makes the build much more playable, in a dispel heavy environment getting fast level 24 asap is critical, then one will find getting epic mage armor and epic warding valuable too!
I have explored both in HiPSing Speed Caster, I've got her up to about level 27, she's a sorc as well.

Other additions to the Wizard/Rogue concept might be Arcane Archer and Pale Master.
Arcane Archer boosts the AB of attacks. Second Sons of Solonor is a elven hybrid greatsword - longbow - wizard 24 with melee and ranged AB 39, 4 APR and wizard 9 spells, trapping and stealth, I've got him to about level 25. The wizard progression is a little slower early on due to the 4 APR in the build. You'd have to give up on crossbows with AA however.
Another idea might be Pale Master / Crossbow. I borrowed ideas from Grizzled_Dwarflord's Mestil's Pale Emissary and Half-Dead Juggernaut damage shield build and made a rogue version of them.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
@ Stagmeister : Thanks for the link and input. It helps bringing more perspective to the build.

@ Orion : Much thanks for the advice and suggestions. I might post another model for the "Arcane Engineer". I decide to try for Gnome (small stature and a bit harder to spot during stealth) or Human (for more skillpoints). In the first model, I go for the level spread of W32/R4/F4 to get EWS crossbow for more crossbow damage. Silent spell is in case you caught ill status "silenced". Craft wand feat is to craft invisible wand. Concentration and spellcraft skills are to hone your spellcasting experience. Tumble for better AC. UMD for being able to use all items/equipments. Hide and move silently skills for stealthing undetected. Disable trap to be able to recover epic traps (too bad you can't craft epic trap). Search to be able to spot traps immediately. Finally, set traps to be able to set epic traps.

Post-Edit Note: Thanks to suggestions from Orion, I re-configured my pre-epic level spread at W14/R3/F3 to increase the ranged AB to 32. For human, I added brew potion feat as an alternative to craft wand so you other than invisible wand, you have another alternative as invisible potion.
2nd Edit note: Brew potion and Auto-Silent III (including silent spell) are out. Great intelligence feats are taken so the final stats are DEX 20 INT 28 for Gnome and DEX 22 INT 28 for human, ranged AB still at 32 for both races and 5 slots for lvl 9 spells with INT 28.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I like how you are trying to push the limits of what is possible, here it is an auto-silent DC spellcaster with CL 32 four meta magic feats, craft wand/scribe scroll, EMA/Epic Warding. 
The secondary attack's AB might struggle. The ranged AB is 27 and BAB 20 due to the Wizard 17 Rogue 1 Fighter 2 pre-epic split provides 2 APR, 3 APR with haste.
I can see 7 feats used for the crossbow (PBS, Rapid Reload, Called Shot, WF, EWF, WS, EWS).
It is quite an investment for a secondary attack. Is it possible to get the AB to mid 30s if one wishes to put 7 feats into it? 
That way with capped dex and true strike, one can hit about 60 AB.

One suggestion is you could gain +1 BAB and +1 APR with a Wizard 16 Rogue 2 Fighter 2 pre-epic split, it would delay level 9 wizard spells to epics.
I would consider dropping Called Shot as the -4 AB penalty with the low AB might be too much to either hit or pass the discipline check.
I would try to put UMD modified to 35, one can use more valuable equipment in intervals of modified 5
I believe only set trap 45 is needed to set epic traps outside of combat but happy to be corrected 
I think you might get more value out of Auto-Still III compared with Auto-Silent III here with the fighter proficiencies. 
Silences are should easy to dispel as the caster level is set to 0 for dispel checks. 
A memorized lesser dispel can be cast despite silence as there is no verbal component, only somatic. 
I have run up to Ogre High Mages with self-silence auras and they have removed my silence aura with this spell despite them being silenced by the aura.
Or a wand of standard dispel will work too. 

For a build with a large investment in a 1/2 BAB class pre-epic I have tried to combine it with an AB boosting class, such as RDD or Arcane Archer 
It is exciting to see one try to test the limits of what is possible without such an AB boosting class.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Oh good point good point!
I forget your dex score is quite significant and you were going to use robes, silly me!
No need for autostill then either as you aren't going to use a shield!

Anyway I wonder if there is something else you could put into the build rather than auto-silent, that would free you 3 feats? 
Maybe Great Intelligence feats to boost up the DC? This will grant you +3 Int. 
I think if you also moved the Greater Spell Focus Necromancy feat at level 21 to pre-epic, drop a feat, perhaps brew potion (unless you plan to sell potions on a Persistent World to non-UMD users? or another reason I am unaware of) and take great intelligence instead, you could have ending Int 28 like you did on your previous draft, but with +5 AB and an extra attack, at the cost of auto-silent, which you may or may not miss, adding that +2 DC and a few bonus spells might make a difference to the firebrands and wail of the banshees that are cast.

I like auto-silent on cleric builds actually, Grizzled_Dwarflord wrote a great autosilent III cleric build Vicar of the Void, the build itself taught me a lot. The premise is to sneak up to enemy spellcasters with a self-silence aura and annihilate them with implosion / word of faith / blade barrier / divine power / other cleric goodness. Without cleric however, the self-silence strategy doesnt work quite as well with scrolls as the CL is 3, so it only lasts 3 rounds but that can help a little, 3 rounds of no spells is still useful.
Maybe other more experienced spell casters can comment too.

posts.content:
Thanks for the advice and compliment, Orion. For the next part, I will try for tertiary SD (Shadow Dancer) at level spread of W32/R3/SD5. SD 5 is for access to Defensive Roll and R3 is for skill dumps at level 40. HiPS is now available to strengthen your stealth experience. Epic reflexes are to increase your reflex saves; gnome at 30 and human at 31. If those reflex saves are low, then epic reflex can be replaced with epic prowess or blind fight. In this build, the ranged AB dropped to 30 for gnome and 31 for human. I might post Arcane Engineer for tertiary  PM sometime later. For tertiary monk, I think I'm gonna pass because all 3 classes of wizard, rogue, and monk are non-prestige classes which makes evading unbalanced class xp penalty trickier. Like Orion said, you need significant monk levels (maybe around 12) to make it "worth it". For now, I present to you:

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You see Defensive Roll a lot in builds, but always as a prerequisite for Epic Dodge.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
@ Empyre65 : Great information, thanks for the insight. Epic dodge is a nice feat to have but the build is a ranged oriented toon with a stealth capability. You should not be on the front, but keep to the rear and providing support for the frontline with your spells, bolts, or traps. For me, epic dodge is great for melee character to avoid incoming melee from the enemy.

Just a minor question, for single player campaign as a stealth PC, do you bother to use your henchman (aka going solo) or micromanage them? As a melee experience, your henchman keeps charging to the nearest mob of enemies even if they are at some distance away (which is a deal breaker for stealth PC because your henchman charging to your enemy head on screaming "Here comes Halfling death!"; dammit Tomi).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I wasn't advocating going for Epic Dodge, which would take away too many caster levels, but advising against taking extra levels of SD for Defensive Roll if you are not going for Epic Dodge.  If you make it Wizard 34 / Rogue 5 / SD 1, you get 2 more Rogue skill dumps and 2 more caster levels, or W 32 / R 7 / SD 1 for even more Rogue skill dumps and the same caster level as before.

If your henchman takes off like that, quickly pause the game, right click the hench (or his portrait), and select Follow Me.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Agree with Empyre65's advice, I wouldn't invest to get Defensive Roll unless one is going for Epic Dodge

If you ever play in a module where you can't pause (eg. a persistent world), then
V-E-E = follow me
V-W-X = stand your ground
V-W-E = attack nearest

Sometimes summons will madly attack mobs of enemies, too many of them sometimes, leading to a party's demise. Very tight control on summons/henchmen prevents this. Sometimes I spam VWX multiple times, as one occasion is sometimes not enough. 

Another option is to put them on stand your ground a long way from the fighting, so they can't cause mischief, then get them to come to you with VWE when you need them.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
On the issue of henchies in single player campaigns, these days I always travel alone in the OC as the AI is bloody dreadful (to put it nicely), and there are always ways of compensating for their supposed skills. I don't know if EE sorted that out at all. The problem you might have is purely one of carrying stuff with a STR of 6 or 8, so you might end up going back and forth countless times to gather your loot (iirc there are only about 6 or 7 proper bags of holding in the whole OC), which would quickly become tedious.

Henchmen do take an upturn in SoU/HotU, and require considerably less micro-management - possibly as more instructions are open to you - and Deekin is always vfm.

Aielund's AI is significantly better, and I always travel with company there (they'll even approach you to ask if they can fight now, which is great if you've forgotten to change their instructions).

Just to build a little on Orion's last tip of parking henchies away from the fighting, as a ranged stealther, you could also pull enemies to you and draw them back to your waiting friend(s) - possibly through a field of pre-laid traps - so you're controlling where and when they engage with the bad guys.

Hope a little of this helps.

Cheers

posts.content:
Thanks again on the level spread and henchman advice, I change it to W35/R3/SD2. SD 2 is for dark vision and R3 is for skill dump. At pre-epic, the level spread is W16/R2/SD2. Epic spell focus is obtained in mid-epic level. Epic reflex is out and changed with Great Dexterity. The changes can be seen in the above posts.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hey NobleSky
Haven't looked through all of it, a lot of it looks good!
Just a point with the wizard/palemaster. Pale master levels dont increase caster levels.
So it is better to have a reasonable number of wizard caster levels before introducing PM. Maybe 6-8 caster levels? That way a spell which lasts 1 turn / level ie ghostly visage, will last 3 hours
Something to consider, Wizard / Palemasters excel with a low AC damage shield strategy, the premise of Grizzled_Dwarflord's Pale Emissary and Half Dead juggernaut builds.
Such a strategy tends to annhilate melee mobs extremely quickly, I can see why these builds utilise that strategy very well.
Until crit immunity is obtained however, make sure you hold onto your hat and buy a lot of healing potions. It is a very wild ride!
If you want the AC lower, that would involve taking points out of tumble and considering going zen archery and wisdom as the AB stat. PM 10 grants +6 AC anyway.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content: @ Orion: Thanks again for the tips and idea for a powerful build made by Grizzled_Dwarflord. However, keeping in mind the Arcane Engineer theme, my build is a ranged stealth with high caster level and focus on trap laying. Many stealth and trap skills use DEX as the stats modifier. Your idea sounds great for non-stealth or non-trap build, so I will keep the idea in mind for possible future build. PM 10 is taken at pre-epic to delay bonus feat from W10 to be taken at epic level and also to have ranged AB at 30 (ranged AB will drop if PM10 is delayed to epic level). I also edited the build so W7 is taken before venturing into 1st level of PM.

posts.content: I like the changes. PM 10 pre epic is nice. I'll have a look in a bit more detail later and make some further comments, if I have any, but overall it looks nice
